intro: Polyalthia andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman tree or Andaman satinwood, is a flowering plant species native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its bark is smooth and greyish, while its leaves are elliptical and glossy. The fruit is a small, smooth, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed.
